ygData.subject: RE: Vampiric embrace or lifetap?
ygData.msgSnippet: Personally I think they should double the damage that VE does or make it go off twice as often (either way). It wouldn t really unbalance the Necro side since
ygData.messageBody:
Personally I think they should double the damage that VE does or make it go
off twice as often (either way). It wouldn't really unbalance the Necro side
since they don't engage in melee that often (at least they shouldn't be).

By the way as an interesting side note, SK's rock in PVP at the later
levels. I beat a lvl 40 monk last night in a duel (Lvl 35 SK). I actually
ended up kind of kiting him. We were in Freeport Arena so it was hard to do,
but I kept hitting him with Eng. Darkness and Heat Blood while I used Shadow
Step repeatedly. Oh and I finished him off with HT before he could mend.
(Engulfing Darkness is a great counter to someone using J. Boots BTW)..



-----Original Message-----
From: Chip Paul [mailto:cpaul@...]
Sent: Monday, September 20, 1999 9:08 AM
To: shadowknight@onelist.com
Subject: Re: [shadowknight] Vampiric embrace or lifetap?


From: Chip Paul <cpaul@...>

Princess Xaera wrote:
>
> From: "Princess Xaera" <xaera@...>
>
> Just as a quick note, the Necro and SK VE are the same spell but do
totally
> different damage. The question is: Why? It should work the same for both
> classes. I don't see a Rangers heal do less then half of a druids. Or a
> paladians heal do half of a clerics for the same spell. If the spell is
> going to act differently should have a different name.
>

I would guess teh damage is based on our level being 8 levels lower
than the necro using it. Rememeber, since we got spells at 9th, our
effective level in casting (and for mana) is 8 levels lower. My VE
is getting better at about 1HP / 2 levels I think.

Xilith
